title: Imarika Discipleship Class - Scripture Memory and Meditation
text:
1.1 Preface
These notes are from the second session of the Imarika Discipleship Class, a series designed to ground believers in foundational spiritual practices. “Imarika” (Swahili for “be firm” or “stand strong”) reflects the goal of this class: to strengthen faith through intentional engagement with God’s Word.
In this session, we focus on Scripture Memory and Meditation, exploring: - Why Scripture Memory - Is it necessary? - How to memorise scripture? - Meditation - How to Meditate on scripture.
These teachings, delivered by Brian Kamara on 12th April 2025, a call to action—to internalize and live out the truths of Scripture.

title: 2  Scripture Memory and Meditation
text:
2.1 Why Scripture Memory.
Ephesians 6:17. The Sword of the Spirit. We are in a war, and the Scripture we have in our heart is the ammunition.
Imagine facing a decision and needing to find guidance. When the Holy Spirit looks for weapons, all He finds is John 3:16 and a few of the commandments memorized in the wrong order.

title: 2  Scripture Memory and Meditation
text:
2.1.1 Is it necessary?
Psalms 119:9-16; 23-24 - Benefits of meditating on Scripture
1 Peter 3:15 - Witnessing.
How did it help the men of the bible?

Jesus - Matthew 4:1-11 - Jesus speaking with the evil one

Peter - Acts 2:14-40 - Peter preaching after the Pentecost

Moses - Numbers 14:17-20



2.1.2 How to memorise scripture?

Have a plan.

Speak aloud and write out the verse

Memorise the verse word perfect.

Avoid excuses.

I have bad memory. What if I offered you 1000 Ksh. for every word.

I am too busy. A man was able to memorize while on the job.

If I memorize too many, I may become proud.

Be disciplined. Better is a man who rules his spirit than one who takes over a nation.
Find an accountability partner.
Revise and meditate daily. What is measured, grows.

However, scripture memory alone is not what will save. The Pharisees also memorized scripture and quoted it to Jesus. Satan also memorized scripture.

title: 3  Meditation
text:
3.1 How to Meditate on scripture.
Meditation is deep unrushed thinking about the truths revealed in Scripture in order to understand, believe, and apply them in our lives.
Joshua 1:8
Psalms 1:1-3
Psalms 119:97-100
Oh, how I love your instructions! I think about them all day long. Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, for they are my constant guide. Yes, I have more insight than my teachers, for I am always thinking of your laws.I am even wiser than my elders, for I have kept your commandments.
Rewriting a verse in your own words can really help you put into words the thoughts you have.

title: 3  Meditation
text:
Select and rewrite the verse that you are studying.
Write out the message of the verse.
Look at the context of the verse
Write down questions that arise from the verse.
Application. Ask God to show you how to apply the verse to your life.
Proof of memory. Try and memorize the verse.
Sharing with people. Whenever you speak with someone, encourage them with what you are learning.

title: 4  Group Discussion Questions.
text:
Different people memorize Bible verses for different reasons. Why do you
want to begin/continue memorizing Scripture?
If I continue to memorize one verse of Scripture every week of the year, what
benefits would I experience?
If I were to make this a lifelong habit, what benefits would I enjoy?
Has memorizing scripture ever helped you in your life? Kindly share with us.
Let’s think together. How will I commit to memorize scripture? How can we
keep each other accountable?

Read this passage of scripture together.
Psalms 19:7-11
